DataElement.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for differentiated thyroid carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Pathologic N Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma. (NCI05)

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the thyroid gland and shows extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary or follicular carcinoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/3/20 tmt released. 11/29/18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Differentiated and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of papillary, follicular, Hurthle cell, poorly differentiated, and anaplastic thyroid carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Metastasis to unilateral, bilateral, or contralateral lateral neck lymph nodes (levels I, II, III, IV, or V) or retropharyngeal lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Metastasis to unilateral, bilateral, or contralateral lateral neck lymph nodes (levels I, II, III, IV, or V) or retropharyngeal lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Metastasis to level VI or VII (pretracheal, paratracheal, or prelaryngeal/Delphian, or upper mediastinal) lymph nodes. This can be unilateral or bilateral disease. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Metastasis to level VI or VII (pretracheal, paratracheal, or prelaryngeal/Delphian, or upper mediastinal) lymph nodes. This can be unilateral or bilateral disease. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Metastasis to regional nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Metastasis to regional nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN0a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN0a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One or more cytologically or histologically confirmed benign lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN0a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: One or more cytologically or histologically confirmed benign lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No evidence of locoregional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: No evidence of locoregional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma cN0b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma cN0b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No radiologic or clinical evidence of locoregional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Papillary, Follicular, Hurthle Cell, Poorly Differentiated, and Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma cN0b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: No radiologic or clinical evidence of locoregional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
